It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to specific regions of South America, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that rises above the foliage. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
